intro: Zygolepis, commonly known as the firecracker plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. Zygolepis species often have milky sap and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. These plants are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
